text:
[Starter]: Do you play any sports or keep active? Have you joined any teams or tried something new lately?
[Student]: If so
[Teacher]: , what is it? I'm a pretty active person, and I love playing sports and staying physically fit. Lately, I've been trying to get back into running, which I haven't done in a while. I joined a local running group that meets once a week, and it's been a great way to stay motivated and accountable. I've also been trying to incorporate more strength training and yoga into my routine to improve my flexibility and balance.  I'm really excited to try out a new sport, too! I've always been interested in rock climbing, but I've never had the chance to try it before. Recently, I learned that there's a indoor climbing gym in my area that offers introductory classes and equipment rentals. I'm planning
[Student]: an intense day of practice with my friends who are excited about this thing
[Teacher]: , too! How about you? Do you have a favorite sport or activity that you enjoy doing? What's your fitness routine like? I'm all ears and would love to hear about your experiences and any tips you might have for someone who's looking to get more active.   I'm actually not a huge fan of sports myself, but I do enjoy staying active and moving around. I like to take long walks, go for hikes, and do some light stretching exercises. I find that exercise helps me relax and unwind, especially after a long day. I've also been trying to incorporate more mindfulness and meditation into my daily routine, which has helped me feel more centered and calm. What are your thoughts on the importance of mindfulness and self-care?

STARTER: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
text:
[Starter]: Do you celebrate any holidays with your family? Are there any special traditions or funny stories from past celebrations?
[Student]: Bob Handsome
[Teacher]: , a 45-year-old dad of two, shares his family's holiday traditions and funny moments.  **Bob Handsome:** Ah, holidays with my family? They're the best! We love spending time together, whether it's Christmas, Thanksgiving, or Halloween. Our family's traditions are pretty loose, but we always make sure to have a good time.  For Christmas, we usually start decorating the house on the day after Thanksgiving. My kids, Timmy and Emma, love helping me hang the lights and strings. They're a bit mischievous, so I always make sure to keep an eye on them to prevent any accidents. After we finish decorating, we make a batch of cookies and leave them out for Santa. The kids love writing
[Student]: songs about how they can find their way back home without having to wait until their parents come visit them later this yearIm proud to announce that no one wants to see our children againsays Kate Pratt of Soyne College in DenverTheir parents will be amazed at what they did last weekTimmy and Emma want to learn more about being happy while learning something new each day
[Teacher]: They are excited to learn how to read and write and all that their parents have learned in the second and third gradesMy daughter has always been fascinated by the process of learning, and I'm looking forward to seeing her love of learning grow this yearIt's been a few years since we've had a family member come to visit us in our new home, and we've been missing the family gatherings that come with the holidays.  One year, my husband's family decided to have a big, loud, and boisterous party on Christmas Eve, complete with a loud, off-key rendition of "Jingle Bells" and a game of charades. songs about how they can find their way back home without having to wait until their parents come visit them later this yearIm proud to announce that no one wants to see our children againsays Kate Pratt of Soyne College in DenverTheir parents will be amazed at what they did last weekTimmy and Emma want to learn more about being happy while learning something new each day

teacher_turns.text: , a 45-year-old dad of two, shares his family's holiday traditions and funny moments.  **Bob Handsome:** Ah, holidays with my family? They're the best! We love spending time together, whether it's Christmas, Thanksgiving, or Halloween. Our family's traditions are pretty loose, but we always make sure to have a good time.  For Christmas, we usually start decorating the house on the day after Thanksgiving. My kids, Timmy and Emma, love helping me hang the lights and strings. They're a bit mischievous, so I always make sure to keep an eye on them to prevent any accidents. After we finish decorating, we make a batch of cookies and leave them out for Santa. The kids love writing

They are excited to learn how to read and write and all that their parents have learned in the second and third gradesMy daughter has always been fascinated by the process of learning, and I'm looking forward to seeing her love of learning grow this yearIt's been a few years since we've had a family member come to visit us in our new home, and we've been missing the family gatherings that come with the holidays.  One year, my husband's family decided to have a big, loud, and boisterous party on Christmas Eve, complete with a loud, off-key rendition of "Jingle Bells" and a game of charades.
